segment.source: The map control can display road maps and aerial views, directions, search results, and traffic.
segment.target: The map control can display road maps and aerial views, directions, search results, and traffic.

segment.source: Guidelines for maps
segment.target: Guidelines for maps

segment.source: Map control
segment.target: Map control

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: The map control can display road maps, aerial, 3D, views, directions, search results, and traffic.
segment.target: The map control can display road maps, aerial, 3D, views, directions, search results, and traffic.

segment.source: On a map, you can display the user's location, directions, and points of interest.
segment.target: On a map, you can display the user's location, directions, and points of interest.

segment.source: A map can also show aerial 3D views, Streetside views, traffic, transit, and local businesses.
segment.target: A map can also show aerial 3D views, Streetside views, traffic, transit, and local businesses.

segment.source: example of a map, basic view
segment.target: example of a map, basic view

segment.source: Is this the right control?
segment.target: Is this the right control?

segment.source: Use a map control when you want a map within your app that allows users to view app-specific or general geographic information.
segment.target: Use a map control when you want a map within your app that allows users to view app-specific or general geographic information.

segment.source: Having a map control in your app means that users don't have to go outside your app to get that information.
segment.target: Having a map control in your app means that users don't have to go outside your app to get that information.

segment.source: Note If you don't mind users going outside your app, consider using the Windows Maps app to provide that information.
segment.target: Note If you don't mind users going outside your app, consider using the Windows Maps app to provide that information.

segment.source: Your app can launch the Windows Maps app to display specific maps, directions, and search results.
segment.target: Your app can launch the Windows Maps app to display specific maps, directions, and search results.

segment.source: For more info, see Launch the Windows Maps app.
segment.target: For more info, see Launch the Windows Maps app.

segment.target: example of 3-d map view with streetside view

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: Use ample screen space (or the entire screen) to display the map so that users don't have to pan and zoom excessively to view geographical information.
segment.target: Use ample screen space (or the entire screen) to display the map so that users don't have to pan and zoom excessively to view geographical information.

segment.source: If the map is only used to present a static, informational view, then using a smaller map might be more appropriate.
segment.target: If the map is only used to present a static, informational view, then using a smaller map might be more appropriate.

segment.source: If you go with a smaller, static map, base its dimensions on usability—small enough to conserve enough screen real estate, but large enough to remain legible.
segment.target: If you go with a smaller, static map, base its dimensions on usability—small enough to conserve enough screen real estate, but large enough to remain legible.

segment.source: Embed the points of interest in the map scene using map elements; any additional information can be displayed as transient UI that overlays the map scene.
segment.target: Embed the points of interest in the map scene using map elements; any additional information can be displayed as transient UI that overlays the map scene.
